info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 12:38AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hudson, eastern Passaic, Union, Bergen, Essex, southern Westchester, Queens, Richmond, Bronx, Kings and New York (Manhattan) Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1237 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over East Brunswick, or over New Brunswick, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newark, Jersey City, Yonkers, Paterson, Elizabeth, Flatbush, New Rochelle, Flushing, Passaic, Bayonne, Wayne, Mott Haven, Hoboken, Plainfield and Bloomfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
